review:
{
    "Summary": "The authors compare methods to emphasize words in neural TTS that use a phoneme duration predictor. They compare a system trained with data with explicit emphasis (where the speaker is instructed to emphasize certain words) with a system trained on data with no explicit labelling of emphasis, for which the durations of the word with emphasis are just multiplied by a certain factor. They demonstrate that the covariations between prosodic dimensions learned by the acoustic decoder significantly improve perceived naturalness over spectrogram modification techniques.",
    "Strengths": [
        " Control of emphasis that does not require explicit recordings nor labelling"
